page.title: 15History 2.
page.content: In 1648,the first skirmish of the Civil War took place in the fields near Powick. Royalist cavalry rode unwittingly into a camp of Roundheads near the bridge. Both were so startled that in the confusion the Cavaliers escaped with the King's treasure in- tact. In 1651 Cromwell's army went through Powick on the way to a more bloody battle against King Charles II,in Worcester. In 1708, Dr.John Wall,was born in Powick,and he was responsible for the development of Royal Worcester Porcelain,the Royal Infirmary,and Malvern's growth as one of the more austere Spa towns.
